name: system-config-group-info
description: System group configuration information detected, including REDACTED_[SECRET_VALUE]_PLACEHOLDER, nobody, REDACTED_[SECRET_VALUE]_PLACEHOLDER, and guest groups. While no direct credentials are included, these group configurations may affect system permission assignments.

name: igmprt-conf-analysis
description: No hardcoded credentials or sensitive information were found in the file `etc/igmprt.conf`. The file content only contains IGMP protocol configuration parameters: 'igmpversion 34' and 'is_querier 1'.

name: netatalk-afp[SECRET_VALUE]-potential
notes: The system restrictions prevent verification of the actual file content. Further analysis requires either relaxing path access restrictions or obtaining a copy of the file.

name: afpd-init-script-analysis
description: A comprehensive scan of the /etc/init.d/afpd file revealed no apparent hardcoded credentials (such as [SECRET_VALUE]s, API [SECRET_VALUE]s, SSH private [SECRET_VALUE]s, etc.) or sensitive information. This file primarily contains the startup script logic for the AFP (Apple Filing Protocol) service.
notes: Although no hardcoded credentials were found, it is recommended to review the specific implementations of the update_user and update_afp functions, as they may involve the handling of user [SECRET_VALUE]entication information.

name: hardcoded-user-group
description: Hardcoded user group information detected, script attempting to modify REDACTED_[SECRET_VALUE]_PLACEHOLDER file to add user group 'alumnux' (GID 506).

name: suspicious-directory-ops
description: Hardcoded directory operations detected, script creates the /home/alumnux directory and sets up symbolic links.
